attributes.action: Apply national space standards to dwellings allowed by permitted development.
attributes.background: Under permitted development rights offices can be converted into residential units & planning authorities are not allowed to consider the size of the dwellings. This has meant dwellings being created of 15 & 16 sqm in size whereas the national space standards require 37 sqm for 1 adult.
attributes.additional_details: It has been reported that in one property in Barnet, for example, 96% of the 254 flats were smaller than the national minimum space standards with the smallest being 16 sqm. In many cases these will be used by more than one adult and even children and contain no outdoor amenity space. It is possible we are storing up a physical and mental health time bomb by creating dwellings of such a small size.

attributes.action: Initiate a Royal Commission examining Policing in the UK
attributes.background: Policing in the UK appears to be at crisis point- the last Royal Commision on Policing was held in 1962, over half a century ago. The policing landscape has significantly evolved in 56 years, and a review of policing practice in the UK is long overdue.

attributes.action: Stop insurers charging interest on monthly payments for motor premiums.
attributes.background: When taking out a motor insurance policy, you either pay for their premiums annually or monthly. However, often, monthly premiums attract high interest rates, making insurance more expensive. This is penalising low income families who can't afford to pay annually.
attributes.additional_details:
The Road Traffic Act 1930 made it a legal requirement to hold a valid motor insurance policy if you drive a car on the public highway with at least third party cover. However, many on lower incomes, who rely on their car, have no choice but to pay monthly and therefore penalised with interest loaded on. The law should be changed so they cannot add interest. 

Insurers say it costs to process monthly payments, but considering Direct Line Group, for example, made a £293.8m pre-tax profit in the first half of 2018 (https://www.directlinegroup.com/~/media/Files/D/Direct-Line-Group-V2/reports-and-presentations/h1-results-2018-annoucement.pdf), it's unfair.

attributes.action: Require companies asking for experience to provide work experience to students
attributes.background: It is becoming harder and harder for students to get a work placement for work experience, and more and more companies are asking for experience for entry level positions. I propose that in order to ask for experience for entry level positions, you must provide it to students within reason.
attributes.additional_details:
https://talent.works/blog/2018/03/28/the-science-of-the-job-search-part-iii-61-of-entry-level-jobs-require-3-years-of-experience/ - Although this is an American article, it shows 61% of 'entry level' jobs require experience.

http://www.ukyouthparliament.org.uk/wp-content/uploads/Manifesto-2015-2016.pdf - Work Experience was one of the top four issues raised by 875,000 young people

https://www.theguardian.com/education/2014/may/23/my-son-keen-learn-struggling-find-work-experience - Old but true

attributes.action: Change the flat rate road tax for a light commercial vehicle (LCV)
attributes.background: The current fee is £250 a year when many modern engines have very good CO2 emissions, when older LCV's that spit out black smoke pay £140 a year.
attributes.additional_details: Many small business owners who need LCV's but are being kind to the environment by getting a newer more eco friendly van instead of a cheaper black smoke machine have no choice but to pay the outdated flat rate fee. It should be replaced with a variable rate which reflects emissions.

attributes.action: Make the use of mobile phones while driving an instant driving ban.
attributes.background:
As an approved driving instructor Every day i see drivers using their phones Clearly the 6 points and £200 fine have not had the desired effect to make people stop using phones while driving
I firmly believe that a three month driving ban would help greatly stop drivers using phones as they drive
attributes.additional_details: I  firmly believe that a three month driving ban would help greatly stop drivers using phones as they drive.making it difficult to get to work without a car . If  put in this position then it will make them think before using the phone while driving.

attributes.action: More effort to increase the peace process between Israel and Palestine
attributes.background: The UK Government should carry out a detailed review of all its efforts towards facilitating the peace process between Israel and Palestine. This review should identify what hasn’t been done and recommend new action that the Government could take.
attributes.additional_details: For so long people have seen these two states as enemies and for too long innocent people have been brought into a conflict which deeply effects the progression of life in this area of the world. It is time for this to stop.

attributes.action: We believe Wythenshawe Community Initiative deserves more funding
attributes.background: Wythenshawe Community Initiative are a child daycare centre that provide a safe space for children to play and be looked after, whilst parents are working. Everyday they have children and parents lining up to get a place in however many are turned away due to lack of funding and staff.
attributes.additional_details:
They are a non-profit organisation, based in Manchester and are for children from the ages of five to eleven. 

In 2017 they fundraised £3,498.52 but this is nowhere near enough to support the centre. Many children who turn up at the centre go without breakfast and staff struggle to provide them with enough food due to the lack of money.

attributes.action: Do not endorse Zimbabwe’s harmonised 2018 elections
attributes.background: There is growing evidence that the outcome of Zimbabwe’s harmonised elections was not a result of a free and fair electoral process. This was followed by post-election violence and the alleged slaughter and beatings of civilians by the army.
attributes.additional_details:
Abductions and an intensified crackdown on the opposition is ongoing.

As an activist, and with many Zimbabweans I am appealing to the UK parliament and government to: - suspend further economic, bilateral engagement with Zimbabwe's govt until there is clarity on its human rights situation; -recognise the unsafe political environment in Zimbabwe for opposition and activists; -strongly support concerns raised by EU, Zimbabwe Human Rights Groups and the USA on elections in Zimbabwe; put pressure on Zimbabwe's govt to account for the killing of innocent civilians by the army.

attributes.action: All English Local Authorities to notify residents by post of new Consultations
attributes.background: When introducing any legislation affecting residents, The Local Authority/Council must serve notice of any consultation or proposal directly on ALL residents, in additional languages if required, by way of postal service. Local Authorities across England are failing to comply with this requirement
attributes.additional_details: A specific example of this is the introduction of Selective Licensing in Luton, ALL residents in the affected areas have not been informed of the Consultation. The outcome of this consultation will affect all residents of Luton. We are asking for people across England to support this if they have had a similar experience with their Local Authority failing to consult with them on important changes affecting their town/city.

attributes.action: Review the provision of hospital meals.
attributes.background: Every hospital has a responsibility to provide the highest level of care possible for their patients and this  includes the quality and nutritional value of the food served
attributes.additional_details: Whilst meals are provided three times per day, they are not always edible and are often left on a heated trolley which changes the taste & texture of foods, often making the meals inedible, particularly to the more vulnerable

attributes.action: Fund baby milk on prescription to all babies who need it.
attributes.background: In some areas of the country, parents are being told that they will have to pay for their baby's prescribed milk for conditions such as CMPA. Parents may have to find around £500, depending on the brand, for the milk powder their child is prescribed, when other normal milks are far cheaper.
attributes.additional_details: The UK Government must provide funding to ensure that baby milk is available free to all babies who need it. We are constantly told Breast is Best, but that isn’t the case for all babies for various medical reasons. Some mums simply don’t want to breast feed and that is their choice. Many other products can be obtained on the NHS for free such as nicotine patches and methadone. Babies don’t ask to have an intolerance.

attributes.action: Make Homework voluntary for students in Secondary School
attributes.background: Homework should be voluntary as children with a high homework load often suffer from mental health problems such as anxiety and depression. The homework given to a child should be limited and not compulsory to allow time to relax, enjoy physical activities and to sleep.

attributes.action: Make identity theft a punishable crime
attributes.background: A fraudster entered into a loan agreement in my name, but I could not record it as a crime. Technically loan companies, banks and so on are the victims of such crimes.
attributes.additional_details: Identity theft should be a separate offence with the person whose identity is stolen identified as the victim and the identity thief punished.

attributes.action: Time limit insurance companies keeping a record of insurance voids
attributes.background: Insurance voids can happen for many reasons, careless errors, unintentional ommissions, financial difficulty, negligence, black box insurance contraventions. It's fair to punish offenders but not for life, this needs to be timelimited like penalty points on a license.

attributes.action: Fund IVF for every same-sex female couple who meets NICE criteria
attributes.background: It’s so expensive for same sex couples to have IVF treatment. I think that it should be as easy for same-sex couples to have a baby on the NHS as it is for heterosexual couples. It’s hard to find the money for IVF treatment even with a full-time job, why can it not be made simpler?

attributes.action: Legislate an affordable car insurance maximum premium for younger drivers.
attributes.background: The current ability for insurance companies to charge in excess of £1500 for a 1lt small car for younger drivers is a detriment to the ability of young people to make themselves mobile and thus employable. I would ask that the house assesses the possibility of a price cap for Car insurance in the UK
attributes.additional_details: Of course, it is expected that more powerful vehicles are charged at a higher premium, however, the government's ability to help young people become more mobile within the uk offers huge benefits to both the individual and the winder economy. It is argued that the leading cause of unisured drivers in the uk is cost and so this practice also could contribute to a reduction of uninsured deivers on the road thus elevating some risk to other drivers. Let us not price young people out of mobility.

attributes.action: The Armenian Genocide should be recognised by UK Parliament - 1.5 million died!
attributes.background: The House of Commons still doesn't recognise the Armenian Genocide in which 1.5m Armenians were systematically exterminated by the Ottoman Caliphate during WWI.
attributes.additional_details:
Armenian Genocide avoidance remains semi-official policy to appease Turkey.
 
The House of Commons has recognised other events as genocide. Yet the UK refuses to join the 29 countries, which label the killing of 1.5 million Armenians as 'genocide' - bearing in mind they were an ethnic and religious minority in the Ottoman Empire. 
 
The motives for this inconsistency can be left for you to decide.
 
Please sign and share this petition.

attributes.action: Make it government policy to campaign to outlaw private military companies
attributes.background: Since the murder of Khashoggi, our government has struggled to know how to respond to Saudi Arabia. There have been calls to end arms sales. However, there are other sellers. Outlawing private military companies, which are being used in the Yemen war, could be effective.
attributes.additional_details: Private military companies can create many security threats. They can be hard to hold accountable for war crimes. Being profit driven, private military companies might take dangerous clients if they’re the highest bidder.

attributes.action: Introduce a system for SIA's to give police more support
attributes.background: Here in my town there are street wardens but after 8pm they sign out they are sia too and from that there is not enough support to the police on busy thursay friday and saturday nights and at times it can be hard to keep the public safe
attributes.additional_details:
I believe there should be more powers for us SIA's like carrying handcuffs and powers of arrest giving out 24 hour town/city bans for behaviours ect and be on pertols and giving police more support and numbers to keep public safe
A police offer said last weekend he was 1 of 10 on duty with 60 cases to deal with on going and over 100 999 callers also tonight there is another team for club pertol of 6 offercers but that's not really enough to keep the public safe in a busy town
We need a change

attributes.action: Mechanism for second Brexit Referendum that will resolve the current stalemate
attributes.background:
The 'Leave' Campaign won the first referendum but there was little definition about what 'Leave' meant and now there is no agreement about what to do next.

The Conservatives are split, no-one knows what Labour want and the Liberals are irrelevant.

We have a stalemate and we need a way out.
attributes.additional_details:
We need a new referendum offering the 3 options of Hard Brexit, Theresa May's Deal and Remain. The successful option would need to be supported by all MP's

We need to avoid splitting the Remain or Leave votes across the 'Middle Option'.

Voters would get a 1st and 2nd choice in the vote. If no option wins greater than 50%  of the 1st choice votes then the lowest scoring option would be eliminated and the 2nd choice votes from that option counted. 

All options represented with one clear winner

attributes.action: Allow Robert Rihmeek Williams (Meek Mill) into the UK
attributes.background: Robert Rihmeek Williams'(aka Meek Mill) first taste of prison came at the age of 18 when he was caught carrying a gun while shopping at a local grocery store. He has spent his adult life on probation and has been treated unfairly by police officers and courts.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.nytimes.com/2018/11/26/opinion/meek-mill-criminal-justice-reform.html
 
Meek Mill and 76ers Owner Michael Rubin have decided to help get wrongfully accused convicts in the United States out of prison. In the UK we should revisit Meek Mill's visa application, because not only does he connect with many people here, but he can also help the UK by talking to the youth especially with our alarming knife crime statistics this year alone.

attributes.action: To stop the import of Butterflies and insects.
attributes.background: I'm starting this petition to stop the import of Butterflies and insects to be used as ornaments.

attributes.action: Require alcohol to be clearly labelled on food products containing it.
attributes.background: Many people boycott alcohol for religious, health beliefs & refuse to come anywhere near it if they are for example recovering alcoholics - whereas just the merest taste of alcohol could lead to fatal consequences.
attributes.additional_details:
Make CLEAR LABELLING - ALCOHOL CONTAINED MANDATORY FOR FOOD PRODUCTS.
 
Some religions boycott alcohol 
Alcoholics and other addicts cannot touch alcohol
 
Sometimes alcohol is obscurely written (mince pies / Christmas cakes etc) and not easily detected.
 
Any food product that contains alcohol or was produced with alcohol must have a big label stating alcohol was used in the production of this product.

attributes.action: Grant full time students access to a Maternity Allowance
attributes.background: Many full time students who fall pregnant or give birth during their studies, are unable to access statutory maternity pay or allowance. These are one of the few groups of women who are missing out on their maternity rights. Let’s give full time students access to maternity allowance.
attributes.additional_details:
The lack of access occurs when a student hasn’t worked in the qualifying period - you can see how that works here (see maternity allowance and statutory maternity pay): 
https://www.staffsunion.com/advice/money/financeguides/parents/

We suggest full time students should automatically have access to maternity allowance or that a special allowance be drawn up to accommodate these cases that provides equivalent support.

attributes.action: Reopen the Exeter to Plymouth Railway line via Okehampton
attributes.background:
Exeter to Plymouth has currently one railway line connecting two big cities. The current railway line in bad weather is always being closed to trains. This cuts off Plymouth and Cornwall from the rest of the country.
Reopening the Okehampton route will help the situation.

attributes.action: Amend the Sexual Offence Act 2003 to include female rape
attributes.background: The current Sexual Offences Act 2003 is gender-bias as the law only legally recognises sexual offences committed by males as rape. This neglects those (males and females) who have been have been sexually assaulted by females.
attributes.additional_details:
I propose the following changes to the legislation 
 
Rape 
1) A person (A) commits an offence if— 
(a) A intentionally penetrates the vagina, anus or mouth of another person (B) with any part of person's (A) body, 
(b) A intentionally penetrates their own vagina, anus or mouth with another person’s (B) body, 
(c) B does not consent to the penetration, and 
(d)A does not reasonably believe that B consents.

attributes.action: Regulate Airbnb and other short term lets of under one month
attributes.background: Properties are being changed from homes into cheap accommodation. This subjects the Hotel and B&B industry to unfair competition, increases rents as there are less properties available. This is also contributing to homelessness and is destroying local communities
attributes.additional_details: Make it the law that all Airbnbs and other short term lets of under one month have to require a change of use through the Local Planning Authority and be registered. They will also have to apply for the same entertainment and alcohol licences plus food hygiene and health and safety regulations as a Hotel or Bed & Breakfast. They will have to reapply annually for their licence and objections can be raised as in any other licensed premises. The property will also be subject to business rates

attributes.action: Make Ofsted inspections every 3 years for all schools, regardless of grading.
attributes.background: Ofsted should inspect all schools regularly, every 2/3 years, regardless of previous inspection results.

attributes.action: Urge the USA not to adopt “Title IX”
attributes.background: The policy, Title IX, would effectively define Transgenderism out of the law. It states that sex is the only determining factor in gender and that it can’t be changed. By suggesting this, the White House would be removing all protections for transgender Americans or individuals who live or visit.
attributes.additional_details: This is not a British issue yet, it is vital that we set up and shut this down. By introducing this policy America becomes an affront to not just LGBT+ rights, but to human rights. Trans rights are human rights and we, the United Kingdom and Europe, have an honourable and proud tradition of guarding these rights and sharing them around the world. If one of our closest trading partners and allies can introduce something like Title IX, and we don’t stop them, then where does that put us?

attributes.action: Make it a requirement for Supermarkets to give all leftover produce to homeless
attributes.background: The amount of food waste by Supermarket’s in the UK stands at 1.9 million tonnes and that is simply sickening when there are 8 million people living in food poverty today.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for single-use plastic to be visible or used in TV Advertising.
attributes.background: By removing single use plastic from view, we will decrease its popularity. It will no longer be a novelty to buy coffee in a "fashionable" plastic cup. Instead, bringing your own reuseable cup will become popular. This will force companies using single-use plastics to find a safe alternative.
attributes.additional_details:
We have no time to waste and the battle against plastic must be addressed from all angles. This is a serious threat to our planet,

https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-45775309

https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-36882799

Please help me do this.

attributes.action: Install Traffic Lights on M1 J29 Southbound Exit Sliproad
attributes.background: Anyone who regularly commutes using Junction 29 of the M1 will know how much of a problem traffic is at peak times when trying to exit the motorway when travelling southbound.  Installing traffic lights could significantly reduce time spent in traffic and reduce the risk of collisions when exiting.
attributes.additional_details: by signing this petition hopefully we will finally have some much needed traffic lights installed.  This will reduce the amount of collisions that happen on that roundabout, the time spent sat in traffic and also the danger of queuing back onto the motorway at peak travel times.

attributes.action: Require MPs to give a full explanation when they refuse to represent you.
attributes.background: MP can refuse to represent constituents and choose not to reply to any form of communication unless legally obligated eg subject access request. They do not need to give an explanation, it leaves constituents cut off from all lines of communication if they wish to ask questions of their government.
attributes.additional_details:
There is no way to challenge their decision. 

Apparently it’s an MP’s democratic right to not represent you or give an explanation which I find utterly ridiculous as they are there to hold the government accountable. 

This ability that MPs have to cut off constituents from questioning their government is wholly unacceptable. The rules should be changed so they have to give an explanation.

attributes.action: Anything plastic must be made with a minimum of 50% recycled material by 2022
attributes.background: We the UK public demand plastic manufacturers take responsibility for the problem created by plastic and that the government regulate this as soon as possible

attributes.action: Require hospitals to have specialist consultants in all fields of trauma
attributes.background: My son was hit by a car and suffered serious injuries, he was rushed to Aintree trauma unit and they put in an induced coma, he suffered head and chest injuries. He was transferred to Walton Neuro who are head and spine specialists, not lungs. My son was in the wrong hospital for his lungs.
attributes.additional_details: My son was in a head and spine specialist hospital who dealt with his head injuries, but he had suffered broken ribs and was sick at the scene and had lung problems. The hospital he was transferred to didn't have a specialist in to treat my son's lungs, if it was a multi specialist hospital my son might of survived. Too many patients are in the wrong hospital for their injuries, there needs to be a range of specialists available.

attributes.action: Boost UK trade and global image by inviting China and Japan to rename islands
attributes.background: Britain is a force for good in the world. Remain and Brexit voters agree that we need to show the world that we are open for business. By brokering a new name for the disputed Senkaku/Diaoyu islands in the East China Sea, the Foreign Office can highlight our shared values - and encourage trade.
attributes.additional_details: China and Japan are the second and third biggest economies in the world and are creating investment and jobs in British industry. They dispute who owns a group of islands in the East China Sea. Resolving the dispute is a matter for China and Japan, but the UK can play a valuable role by symbolically inviting the two governments to rename the islands to reflect their and our shared values - for example the Confucius Islands or the Friendship Islands. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Senkaku_Islands

attributes.action:
Change minimum wage to at least £10 an hour. 

Stop the struggle!
attributes.background:
Life is a struggle already, without factoring in the low minimum wage the uk are made to endure. Living cost keeps going up, but we are all stuck trying to climb back on top.

We need this to change our country and to better it, and create a future that is bright.
attributes.additional_details:
Life within our current economic climate is a struggle, and stability is essentially unachievable. Living costs are increasing but minimum wage is staying the same. 

Therefore, we need to galvanise our country  into making a change and to ensure our future generations are prosperous

attributes.action: Prevent Horses from being ridden on roads to protect both riders and horses
attributes.background: It's clear that the speed differential between vehicles and horses being ridden on roads poses a risk to both the horse and rider. Even at safe speeds this can pose a risk.Its now time to consider the proper use of our roads in a modern transportation system.
attributes.additional_details: The horse has no say in the matter of being exposed to the danger of being ridden on a road with cars, motorcycles and commercial vehicles.

attributes.action: Abolish the private education system by nationalising private schools.
attributes.background:
Private schools have always been a tool for the wealthy to ensure they have the best opportunities in life. 

For a society in which equal opportunity is one of the core principles, it is a disgrace to allow an inherent advantage to some children based on the size of their parents’ wealth.
attributes.additional_details:
Students from private schools were 8% more likely than the average student to attend an Oxbridge university in 2016. Apart from a better chance at higher grades, this is part of the high quality reputation schools like Eton gain, which makes them much more likely to get in.

It is this unfairness that means we are calling on the Government to take private schools under public control, give them the same funding as other state schools, and ensure there is greater equality of opportunity for all.

attributes.action: Review use of polygraph tests in Courts
attributes.background: How many cases have you read about or seen on the news where years down the line after conviction they have been found innocent? Too much money is paid out in compensation today to alleged 'victims'. People suffer injustices. I demand a change.
attributes.additional_details: This petition is an attempt allow polygraph tests to be used as evidence for both victim and the accused in a Court of Law. Please help me raise awareness on this subject and get this change implemented.

attributes.action: Devise a national public campaign to increase awareness of Bone Marrow Donation.
attributes.background:
Currently only 2% of people in the UK are registered as stem cell donors. This compares to 13% in Cyprus, 12% in Israel and 9% in Germany. 
This is due to the lack of public awareness of what bone marrow donation is and how further simplified and painless the procedure of donating can be.
attributes.additional_details:
90% of people now donate directly from their bloodstream, in a procedure known as peripheral blood stem cell donation (PBSC)

There is no government public campaign highlighting this important detail.
There are many who have never been informed that there is such a register. Yet a high number of those who do are discouraged by the myth that by donating, it is a very painful procedure. 
There are more life savers out there. The government must invest in raising awareness surrounding this subject.

attributes.action: Change the name of the House of Lords to the House of Peers.
attributes.background: This petition is simply to ask the Government to address the patriarchal traditions that still exist within Parliament. They should acknowledge the fact that the House of Lords has contained women since 1958, and therefore should evolve to reflect changing society and the make up of our laws.
attributes.additional_details:
Women were excluded from the House of Lords until the Life Peerages Act 1958 passed to address the declining number of active members. 

The first women in the House of Lords took their seats in 1958, forty years after women were granted the right to stand as MPs in the House of Commons. There are 209 female peers out of 798 in the House of Lords today. Women make up 25% of the total members, compared with 32% for women in the House of Commons.

attributes.action: Recognise a day of rememberance for victims of slavery and human trafficking
attributes.background: In the U.K., we recognise Remembrance Sunday to mourn those killed in the first and second world wars and other conflicts worldwide. Why do we not apply the same reverence and respect to people enslaved around the world today, and generations previously?

attributes.action: Reverse VAT Charges now payable by Residents living in Retirement Accommodation.
attributes.background: All Leaseholders living in Retirement Flats in future are liable for the new VAT Charge.  This is being passed on by the Management Agents to Residents for the VAT on their Site Staff Salaries, Employers  N.I.  and Pension Contributions which was introduced in Sept 2018.  With effect from Nov.2018.
attributes.additional_details: It is essential in Retirement properties to have a Site Manager and whose salary etc. is included within the monthly service charge.  This additional increase by the Government will put financial pressure on pensioners.   As the rule stands now we have no option but to pay this unfair charge.  We take pride in being self supporting and feel strongly that we are being penalized by this new ruling.

attributes.action: Repeal the Fixed-term Parliaments Act 2011
attributes.background: The Act was meant to prevent a hung Parliament after the 2010 general election. It has outlived its usefulness and in the current political situation in the country prevents the electorate from exercising their democratic will.

attributes.action: Make the Highway Code compulsory in the national curriculum.
attributes.background:
The Highway Code is for everyone, not just licensed drivers.

Better education is required for All highway users to improve safety, awareness and misconceptions regarding highway safety for everyone and reduce the risk of incidents.

attributes.action: Improve the safety of Scammonden Bridge
attributes.background: I am hoping that safety measures can be put into place on the Scammonden Bridge over the M62 to try and prevent the increasing number of suicides in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
Scammonden Bridge over the M62 is becoming more and more popular for people taking their own lives. Especially over the last few years this number has increased significantly and it was only yesterday that someone lost their life on this Bridge. 

I am hoping with all your support that this issue could be addressed by the government and a metal safety barrier be constructed on the bridge to prevent anymore suicides occurring. 

All support will be greatly appreciated.

attributes.action: Ban inflatable bouncy slides at private and public events
attributes.background: Our daughter, one week after her 4th birthday, broke her arm sliding down and rolling off the end of a bouncy slide. Hearing the agony she was in and the trauma she went through to get better was heartbreaking and would not want any other child to go through this preventable accident.
attributes.additional_details:
After reading news story after news story about serious accidents on bouncy slides, also hearing from friends about children hurting themselves, it seems everyone has a story of some degree about the dangers of these slides and we believe it's cause for a total ban on this equipment.

If you agree, please sign this petition and hopefully we can have this matter brought up in Parliament.

attributes.action: Adjust child benefit so that the payments are higher for young children.
attributes.background: I believe young children are harder to support than older children and receive very little help.   Currently child benefit is the same through a child's life.   I believe child benefit should be larger when the child is under 4 and then decrease as they get to 5 and when they become a teenager.
attributes.additional_details:
When a child is over 3 years old parents get support with child care costs.   
https://www.gov.uk/help-with-childcare-costs/free-childcare-and-education-for-2-to-4-year-olds

When the child gets close to 5 years old it goes to school, which is a form of child care.
https://www.gov.uk/schools-admissions/applying

When a child becomes a teenager their work restrictions become more lenient:
https://www.gov.uk/child-employment/restrictions-on-child-employment
